title: How to live right when so much wrong is around you - Quora

response.answer_text: First, let me say that everything borders on the ideas that one learns, internalize, and adopted as his or her own. Ideas are introduced to us by what we continuously see, hear, touch, feel, and smell. That is movies, the music we listen to, the food we eat, the chemicals we introduce to our bodies, and the experiences we permit in our lives. The theory of learning is this, whatever you and I are continually exposed to, that we will begin to accept, permit, and allow as normal eventually. Ideas turn into concepts, thoughts, philosophy, belief, habits, attitude, and then behavior. They automatically set our principles, values, and standard. So everything we say, and do streams from the ideas we have in our mind, ideas we have heard, internalized and accepted as our own. In truth, what someone says, how they behave, their habits is really a manifestation of what is in their heart/mind (core ideas). Thus the quality of our decisions and life, in general, is determined by what source of ideas our life is anchored on. With this knowledge and understanding, the truth is that you and I have no original ideas of our own. What we know today comes from a source somewhere and has been cultured and conditioned from the time we were born to this very day. There are ONLY two sources one can get his ideas from. 1. God (The truth) 2. the Devil (Lies) Your ideas about life today, what you and I know today is anchored on either God or the lies of the devil.  So if I want to live right, make good decisions in my life, if I want a better life, the starting point is changing my original ideas. Until you and I have a mental transformation (change of the entire belief system, that is ideas, thoughts, concepts, philosophy, mentality, principles, values, standard, behavior, habits, and attitude), nothing can truly change. Now if I am, to be honest with you, I had what I thought was my own personal Philosophy about life, I had my principles, standards, and values, all of which I had learned from the time I was born until not long ago. From that time onwards, I am now committed and I am in the process of unlearning or replacing the ideas I have with no other personal philosophy but the philosophy that God defines and directs me to follow. In other words, I am in the process of changing my mindset (repenting), and surrendering my life to God. That to me entails that I have to make a full 180-degree turn, a full personal, unconditional surrender to God as my Lord and Survivor. For this reason, I have been in the process of learning new things based entirely on the Word of God, in the hope that in the end my thoughts, ideas, beliefs, mindset, philosophy, attitude and more so my identity, my standard, the definition of life, my purpose, plans, vision and everything about me should be anchored on what God says, his will, purpose, and plans for me. With this, I know for sure that if I will remain faithful and committed, the decisions I will make now and in the future will always be right. In summary, please know and remember that the quality of my life and yours is found in meaning. Unfortunately, most people assume that Life is all about the challenges that they face, when in fact life is all about the meaning that you and I give to those challenges. Emotions are the fuel of life. The quality of your and my experiences depends on the quality of our emotions. Emotions can be controlled and transformed from negative to positive. Remember negative emotions lead to destruction, while positive emotions lead to growth, personal development, meaning, fulfillment, and happiness.

“How do you live right when so much wrong is around you?” Well my answer is to be as intelligent as any dog is. A dog, can have an absolutely criminal owner, but he will be a good dog throughout his life. No dogs follow the criminal examples of their owners. Dogs are always good creatures, however their owners decide to behave. So, if you can muster the same intelligence as the average dog, then you can easily live in a good way, while the people around you are behaving in the worst way possible. It’s quite simple really. Or at least it’s easier than you think it is. And more difficult as well, I must add. It’s both more difficult than you think it is, and more simple than you think it is. Dogs are far more intelligent than human beings are you see. Dogs are almost infinitely more intelligent than human beings are in fact. So, you’d have difficulty in being as intelligent as a dog, unless you were one of those very rare human beings who are as intelligent as dogs are. Dogs have practically infinite intelligence, whilst humans are very limited with their biocomputer minds, which give them the intelligence of well-programmed computers, but not the intelligence of living creatures. To have the intelligence of a blade of grass ,or a worm, or an oak tree, or a daisy, or an elephant or a shark, or a dolphin, or a lion, or a seagull, or anything living that is intelligent, you have to be able to perceive the infinite variables of every situation. Those unfortunate human beings with biocomputer minds in their heads, are only capable of perceiving a very limited selection of variables. So, they are handicapped the human beings are. Human beings messed things up in their development many thousands of years ago. So, as a group some human beings know this , and some of them know that, and they need to be in millions altogether to discover as much about the World as any dog can find out on his own in a flash. And usually the human beings don’t find out anything even when they are millions all together, because they are so busy lying to each other, and trying to trick and deceive each other. So, the human species of the Earth is a failure, full stop. That’s the truth really.

For 300,000 years people have been living and doing what people do including comflict digging holes talkin smack breeding living and dying. Living right is a personal choice and a personal perspective unique to each of us. Watching to much ‘news daily’ does weight heavy on the mind. How to live right is in the face of a frantic world ? Doing what you know is healthy for You, doing what you feel is nurturing for you so you can wake the next day to experience the life you like. Just by taking care of YOU others are encouraged to do the same by your example, this includes strangers. By self care you radiate a positive energy others notice.

In this time of our history, there is much going on but no matter what the turmoil is, it is not ever about that turmoil, it is only about you, the individual. As an individual, you are the only decider, the only council, the only figurehead that needs to be taken care of. I am a firm believer in the individual, not the crowd. I believe in making an informed choice as to my own direction and hold myself to the highest standards I can muster. I am the sole master of those things that I can control, all else can twist and turn around me but I don’t have too. I was sitting on the banks of a stream once, it was late fall and there were tons of leaves being swept down that stream, big parcels of leaves stuck together rushing towards a connecting river and that river was heading towards the vast ocean. But here and there, along the shoreline were little backwater eddies, and in those little eddies were a few leaves were not being pushed by the full force of that stream. Those few leaves had somehow found a reprieve from the course most leaves were caught up in. Little spots to rest while the majority flowed full force into the distant ocean. This certainly does not mean those few leaves would not eventually find that same ocean, but it might take longer to get there and who knows what journey they will experience by getting out of the general flow. Take this image and use it well. If you choose to go with the flow with others, of being part of a crowd that is chasing the bandwagon down the road, then that is a choice, but not the only choice. As an individual, stepping out of the crown will allow you to choose well, to make a different choice that is right for you. This does not mean you bury your head in the sand, but to look directly at the turmoil and decide whether you wish to march in step with the crowd or not. This in never about what all the others are doing, it is about what you are going to do. I cannot tell you what to do nor think you should think the same as me. I would be egotistical to assume anything for anyone else. So if the world is not standing on balanced feet, then maybe, just maybe, we as individuals need to balance ourselves first. The first step in solving any problem is knowing we have a problem. The second step is to decide what you, as an individual, is going to do about it. Fixing a broken leg in one thing, but if we have a broken leg, we had better fix that first before we can help others with their broken legs. I would rather stand on my own, choose my own course of action, decide for myself than follow the parade down the road to one tune, only to find the parade coming back down that same road playing a different tune with the same crowd in tow. Individual are the solid foundation to all life and when that foundation is broken, only the individual can ever rebuilt it. I trust in the individual to do what is right before I trust in the crowd deciding for me. Just Sayin’

You, and all others were given Free Will, although many in society try to take that way from us. You are fully Free to do what is Right even though everyone else is doing things that are wrong. Your Destiny is not going to be distorted by what others do; but only by what you choose to do. Your options change, of course, but still it is what you choose to do that matters! The excuse that others are doing what is wrong will not wash! Excuses don’t count!

I don't live within the boundries of “right and wrong.” Seriously, that's not a cop-out answer! A “value,” as it seems to be in this modern day, is a metaphysical thought pattern coupled with an emotion. A common value is “right,” “good" “positive,” all of which are different words for the same experience. Usually, unfortunately, that means “wrong,” “bad,” and “negative" is devalued and moved away from like it's the plauge, and the process of moving away from the negative and towards the positive often results in more negativity than if we didn't move towards the positive so much, ironically enough.

With enough strength, conformity’s power decreases. When you go to a park with most of its visitors not wearing a mask during COVID, by wearing a mask yourself, you become separated from the problem. No need to fight nor join forces; all you should do to live rightfully/lawfully is to not intensify the case by being its henchman. Neutrality’s a reasonable solution as well.

How do you live right when so much wrong is around you 1 I don’t think there is so much wrong around me. 2 There are some wrongs and many rights also. 3 I try to live the best I can, without being influenced or bothered by the wrongs around me. Peace! 9 July 2020

I believe the only difference between animals and human beings is the conscience. And this gives us a moral compass within us that directs us towards right by default because most of us are innately good and believe in doing good and being right. If each one of us allowed our conscience to speak up into our spirit before we acted on our thoughts, then the good conscience and right conscience will grow and eventually defeat the wrong around.

First, how could you know what's right and wrong for others? You would have to know everything about everything. You would have to know each person's purpose at all times. Since you are the decider of what's right and wrong, you can simply withdraw belief into what you think is wrong. Only what's right will remain. Then you'll be free to live unaffected by outside circumstances.
To live right despite the fact that there is so much wrong around you, you need to share God's perspective with Him and believe right.
